Doc: A type defining the way in which interests are accrued: the applicable rate (fixed or floating reference) and the compounding method.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A type defining the way in which interests are accrued: the applicable rate (fixed or floating reference) and the compounding method.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.InterestAccrualsCompoundingMethod {
  # The floating rate calculation definitions
  floatingRateCalculation : FpML5.recordkeeping.FloatingRateCalculation

  # The calculation period fixed rate. A per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. A fixed rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
  fixedRate : decimal

  # If more that one calculation period contributes to a single payment amount this element specifies whether compounding is applicable, and if so, what compounding method is to be used. This element must only be included when more that one calculation period contributes to a single payment amount.
  compoundingMethod : string?

}

fixedRate.Doc: The calculation period fixed rate. A per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. A fixed rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
fixedRate.Name: fixedRate

compoundingMethod.Doc: If more that one calculation period contributes to a single payment amount this element specifies whether compounding is applicable, and if so, what compounding method is to be used. This element must only be included when more that one calculation period contributes to a single payment amount.
compoundingMethod.Name: compoundingMethod
